title: No Display? No Problem: Cross-Device Passkey Authentication for XR Devices
description:
Weâ€™re sharing a novel approach to enabling cross-device passkey authentication for devices with inaccessible displays (like XR devices). Our approach bypasses the use of QR codes and enables cross-device authentication without the need for an on-device display, while still complying with all trust and proximity requirements. This approach builds on work done by the FIDO [...]

title: Whatâ€™s New in vcpkg (Nov 2025 â€“ Jan 2026)
description:
This blog post summarizes changes to the vcpkg package manager as part of the 2025.12.12 and 2026.01.16 registry releases and the 2025-11-13, 2025-11-18, 2025-11-19, 2025-12-05, and 2025-12-16 tool releases. These updates include support for targeting the Xbox GDK October 2025 update, removing a misleading and outdated output message, and other minor improvements and bug fixes. [â€¦]

title: Wayland By Default in 2026.1 EAP
description: Starting from version 2026.1, IntelliJ-based IDEs will run natively on Wayland in supported desktop configurations. This follows Waylandâ€™s ascendance to the position of primary display server across contemporary Linux distributions. By making this change in our EAP releases first, we hope to be able to give more Linux users the opportunity to try the native [â€¦]
creator: Maria Kosukhina

title: Building Prometheus: How Backend Aggregation Enables Gigawatt-Scale AI Clusters
description:
Weâ€™re sharing details of the role backend aggregation (BAG) plays in building Metaâ€™s gigawatt-scale AI clusters like Prometheus. BAG allows us to seamlessly connect thousands of GPUs across multiple data centers and regions. Our BAG implementation is connecting two different network fabrics â€“Â Disaggregated Schedule Fabric (DSF) and Non-Scheduled Fabric (NSF). Once itâ€™s complete our AI [...]

title: dotInsights | February 2026
